section.title: Create a New Project
section.para: To start using OmegaT, you first have to create a project to hold all your files, such as your source files, translation memories, glossaries, and eventually your translated files. To create a new project, select New... in the Project menu (or press CSn), select a folder, and type a name for your project.

note.para: Since an OmegaT project is simply a set of folders and subfolders, you are entering the name of the folder that will hold your project. Alternatively, you can choose an existing empty folder created beforehand. Keep in mind that OmegaT cannot create a project in a folder that already contains files or subfolders.

section.para: Remember where you are creating the project, because you will need to return to it later.
The Create New Project dialog opens after you have named your project. At the top of that dialog, select the languages of your source and translated files, and click the OK button to continue.
If you are interested in other settings in this dialog, you can return to it any time by pressing CtrlE.

The Project Files dialog opens next. Click on Copy Files to Source Folder... and select your source files. OmegaT will then copy the selected files to the source subfolder of your newly created project. You can close the Project Files dialog after the source files have loaded in the Editor pane,.
